name: E.P.IV: A 30-Day Bet
description:
E.P., class of the fourth is an all-human class that E.P. established on a whim. After a "trial run" summer, the class is about to be disbanded by Calvin, E.P.'s superior, due to poor discipline and performance. 

Chen Weizhi, a student of EP IV has to take the leadership position and made a bet with Calvin to save his class. With the help of his classmate Becca, he will get to know his classmates and tutor them in 30 days, while testing his analytical superpowers. How will things eventually develop?

E.P. series, medium-short visual novel with an estimated play time of 1.5-2.5 hours.

Players will take on the role of Chen Weizhi, the leader of E.P., class of the 4th to build friendships with his classmates and experience daily life in E.P. 

The game has one main ending, followed by two additional relationship endings: Rebecca and Natalie (Yu).

Production engine: Unity

Platform: PC (Windows/Mac)

Available storage space required: 1.65GB

Language: English and Simplified Chinese

Production: CityStream Studios

Script: Friolento

Art: Silent

Art Support: Pixabay, Pxhere

Music Support: Epidemic Sound, Audiohero, Pixabay

(For a detailed list, please see the in-game ED)

Note:  Because the game uses a license from Epidemic Sound that covers only the game engine but not its derived video, if one has to upload a video of playing the game to YouTube or any other social media platform, they will be subject to receiving copyright claims unless they have a license from Epidemic Sound as well.

1. This is a derivative work of the E.P. series, so some of the settings and terms come from the E.P. worldview. In the E.P. world, human beings with superpowers are called superhumans. Humans and superhumans coexist on Earth. The vast majority of superhumans live on an immigrant island nation called Lochiodias.

In addition to their special abilities, the archipelago of Lochiodias has a special mineral that carries the ability to analyze superpowers, called Crystal K or Klistonite, which can react with humans and help them analyze and reproduce others’ memories in pictures.

3. CDI is the capital of Lochi. Tuepia is the hometown where the protagonist Chen Weizhi lives, and Tailrae is the state that Tuepia belongs to.

4. E.P. is a small seminar-style educational institution that provides higher education from the 10th grade of high school to the senior year of college. With only six students per class, E.P. generally recruits only superhumans for study.
